title: Hong Kong couple found dead in suspected murder-suicide | South China Morning Post

organizations.name: south china morning post news › hong kong › law & crime hong kong

text:
News › Hong Kong › Law & Crime Hong Kong couple found dead in suspected murder-suicide 
Police were called after a man fell to his death from a building in Diamond Hill on Wednesday morning PUBLISHED : Wednesday, 15 February, 2017, 11:36am UPDATED : Wednesday, 15 February, 2017, 11:36am Print Email 
A Hong Kong couple died in a suspected murder-suicide on Wednesday morning. 
The gruesome incident came to light shortly after 7.30am when a man in his 50s fell to his death from King Ying House at King Shan Court on Fung Shing Street in Diamond Hill. 
A police spokeswoman said a security guard found the man lying unconscious in a flower bed outside the building and called the police. 
“The man was declared dead at the scene,” a police spokesman said. 
An investigation then led police to find the body of a woman in a 15th floor flat in the same building. 
A police source said the pair, in their 50s, were a couple who lived in the flat. 
“Detectives are investigating whether it is a murder-suicide case,” he said. 
The flat was cordoned off as police and pathologists carried out an investigation. 
Officers from the Wong Tai Sin district crime squad are investigating.
